title: Abusing Catalog Hygiene to Bypass Application Whitelisting
description: Introduction Last week, I presented COM Under The Radar: Circumventing Application Control Solutions at BsidesCharm 2019.  In the presentation, I briefly discussed COM and highlighted a few techniques for bypassing Windows application control solutions.  One of those techniques takes advantage of an issue with catalog hygiene where old code often remains signed in updated versions […]

title: NVIDIA Jetson Nano - Docker optimized Linux Kernel
description:
Despite the fact that the NVIDIA Jetson Nano DevKit comes with Docker Engine preinstalled and you can run containers just out-of-the-box on this great AI and Robotics enabled board, there are still some important kernel settings missing to run Docker Swarm mode, Kubernetes or k3s correctly.

So, let’s try to fix this…

Analyzing the Linux Kernel

In my last blogpost Verify your Linux Kernel for Container Compatibility, I already shared all the details how you can easily verify the Linux kernel for all Container related kernel settings. So, this first part of analyzing the capabilities of the stock Linux kernel 4.9.x provided by NVIDIA is already done
